00020 /*! 
00021 
00022 \page txt2mchp_description Writing genotype results to a "multi-data" CHP file.
00023 
00024 This program is provided as an example of using the Fusion SDK to write genotype results to an Affymetrix
00025 "multi-data" CHP file. The multi-data CHP file was designed to store a variety of Affymetrix results,
00026 including genotypes and copy number. The Genotyping Console software currently uses the "multi-data" CHP
00027 file for storing genotype results from the BRLMM-P and Birdseed algorithms as well as copy number results
00028 from its copy number algorithms.
00029 
00030 The program is implemented as a command line application. The arguments specify items such as the TSV file
00031 containing the genotype results, algorithm parameters, summary statistics, probe array type, parent CEL file, 
00032 and other items that are stored in the CHP file header.
00033 
00034  */
00035 #include "calvin_files/converters/utils/src/CmdLine.h"
00036 #include "calvin_files/fusion/src/FusionCELData.h"
00037 #include "calvin_files/utils/src/FileUtils.h"
00038 #include "calvin_files/utils/src/StringUtils.h"
00039 #include "calvin_files/writers/src/CalvinCHPMultiDataFileBufferWriter.h"
00040 #include "calvin_files/writers/src/CalvinCHPMultiDataFileWriter.h"
00041 
00042 #include <vector>
00043 #include <list>
00044 #include <iostream>
00045 #include <fstream>
00046 
00047 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00048 #pragma warning(disable: 4996)
00049 #endif
00050 
00051 using namespace std;
00052 using namespace affymetrix_calvin_io;
00053 using namespace affymetrix_calvin_data;
00054 using namespace affymetrix_fusion_io;
00055 using namespace affymetrix_calvin_utilities;
00056 
00057 /*! Create a "multi-data" CHP file with just the header information. The remainder of the file
00058  * will be created at a later time using the buffer writer technique.
00059  * The CHP file will contain only "genotyping" results.
00060  * @param execId The execution identifier. This identifier is used to identify the batch run that created the CHP files.
00061  * @param celFile The full path to the parent CEL file. The header of the CEL file is copied to the CHP file.
00062  * @param outFile The name of the output CHP file.
00063  * @param extraColNames The names of the extra data columns. Should not include probe set name, call and confidence columns.
00064  * @param extraColTypes The types (float, int, ubyte) of the extra columns.
00065  * @param numEntries The number of rows (entries) of results to store in the CHP file.
00066  * @param maxProbeSetNameLength The maximum length of the probe set names.
00067  * @param algName The name of the algorithm used to create the results.
00068  * @param algVersion The algorithm version.
00069  * @param chipType the chip type, also known as the probe array type.
00070  * @param programName The name of the program used to create the CHP file.
00071  * @param programVersion The version of the program.
00072  * @param programCompany The company or institution who developed the CHP creating software.
00073  * @param paramNames A list of parameter names to store in the CHP file header.
00074  * @param paramValues A list of parameter values to store in the CHP file header.
00075  * @param sumNames A list of summary statistic names to store in the CHP file header.
00076  * @param sumValues A list of summary statistic values to store in the CHP file header.
00077 */
00078 static void CreateFileWithHeader
00079 (
00080         const string &execId,
00081         const string &celFile,
00082         const string &outFile,
00083         const vector<string>& extraColNames,
00084         const vector<string>& extraColTypes,
00085         unsigned long numEntries,
00086         int maxProbeSetNameLength,
00087         const string &algName,
00088         const string &algVersion,
00089         const string &chipType,
00090         const string &programName,
00091         const string &programVersion,
00092         const string &programCompany,
00093         const vector<string>& paramNames,
00094         const vector<string>& paramValues,
00095         const vector<string>& sumNames,
00096         const vector<string>& sumValues,
00097         const vector<string>& extraNames,
00098         const vector<string>& extraValues
00099 )
00100 {
00101         // Create the vector of extra columns. The sample code here supports only float, 32 bit integers and 8 bit unsigned integers.
00102         vector<ColumnInfo> extraColumns;
00103         int ncols = (int)extraColNames.size();
00104         for (int icol=0; icol<ncols; icol++)
00105         {
00106                 if (extraColTypes[icol] == "float")
00107                 {
00108                         FloatColumn fcol(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(extraColNames[icol]));
00109                         extraColumns.push_back(fcol);
00110                 }
00111                 else if (extraColTypes[icol] == "int")
00112                 {
00113                         IntColumn intcol(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(extraColNames[icol]));
00114                         extraColumns.push_back(intcol);
00115                 }
00116                 else if (extraColTypes[icol] == "ubyte")
00117                 {
00118                         UByteColumn ubcol(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(extraColNames[icol]));
00119                         extraColumns.push_back(ubcol);
00120                 }
00121                 else
00122                 {
00123                         throw string("Unsupported column type: ") + extraColTypes[icol];
00124                 }
00125         }
00126 
00127         // Create the data object
00128         CHPMultiDataData *data = new CHPMultiDataData(outFile);
00129     data->SetEntryCount(GenotypeMultiDataType, numEntries, maxProbeSetNameLength, extraColumns);
00130         data->SetAlgName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(algName));
00131         data->SetAlgVersion(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(algVersion));
00132         data->SetArrayType(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(chipType));
00133 
00134         // Store the CEL header
00135         if (celFile.length() > 0 && FileUtils::Exists(celFile.c_str()) == true)
00136         {
00137                 FusionCELData cel;
00138                 cel.SetFileName(celFile.c_str());
00139         cel.ReadHeader();
00140             GenericData *gdata = cel.GetGenericData();
00141             if (gdata != NULL)
00142                         data->GetFileHeader()->GetGenericDataHdr()->AddParent(*gdata->Header().GetGenericDataHdr()); 
00143             cel.Close();
00144         }
00145 
00146         // Add algorithm parameters to list.
00147     ParameterNameValueTypeList params;
00148     ParameterNameValueType param;
00149     
00150         if (programName.empty() == false)
00151         {
00152                 param.SetName(L"program-name");
00153                 param.SetValueText(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(programName));
00154                 data->GetGenericData().Header().GetGenericDataHdr()->AddNameValParam(param);
00155         }
00156 
00157         if (programVersion.empty() == false)
00158         {
00159                 param.SetName(L"program-version");
00160                 param.SetValueText(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(programVersion));
00161                 data->GetGenericData().Header().GetGenericDataHdr()->AddNameValParam(param);
00162         }
00163 
00164         if (programCompany.empty() == false)
00165         {
00166                 param.SetName(L"program-company");
00167                 param.SetValueText(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(programCompany));
00168                 data->GetGenericData().Header().GetGenericDataHdr()->AddNameValParam(param);
00169         }
00170 
00171         int nparams = (int) extraNames.size();
00172         for(int iparam=0; iparam<nparams; iparam++)
00173         {
00174                 param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(extraNames[iparam]));
00175         param.SetValueAscii(extraValues[iparam]);
00176         data->GetGenericData().Header().GetGenericDataHdr()->AddNameValParam(param);
00177         }
00178 
00179         nparams = (int) paramNames.size();
00180         param.SetName(L"exec-guid");
00181         param.SetValueAscii(execId);
00182         params.push_back(param);
00183         for(int iparam=0; iparam<nparams; iparam++)
00184         {
00185                 param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(paramNames[iparam]));
00186         param.SetValueAscii(paramValues[iparam]);
00187         params.push_back(param);
00188         }
00189         if (params.empty() == false)
00190                 data->AddAlgParams(params);
00191 
00192         params.clear();
00193         nparams = (int) sumNames.size();
00194         for(int iparam=0; iparam<nparams; iparam++)
00195         {
00196                 param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(sumNames[iparam]));
00197         param.SetValueAscii(sumValues[iparam]);
00198         params.push_back(param);
00199         }
00200         if (params.empty() == false)
00201                 data->AddSummaryParams(params);
00202 
00203         // Creating the writer object will create the file with the header information.
00204         CHPMultiDataFileWriter writer(*data);
00205 }
00206 
00207 /*! Convert a call to a code
00208  * @param call The call, or can be a code
00209  * @return The code
00210  */
00211 static int CallToCode(const string &call)
00212 {
00213         if (isdigit(call[0]) != 0)
00214         {
00215                 return atoi(call.c_str());
00216         }
00217         else
00218         {
00219                 if (call == "AA" || call == "aa")
00220                         return SNP_AA_CALL;
00221                 else if (call == "AB" || call == "ab")
00222                         return SNP_AB_CALL;
00223                 else if (call == "BB" || call == "bb")
00224                         return SNP_BB_CALL;
00225                 else
00226                         return SNP_NO_CALL;
00227         }
00228 }
00229 
00230 /*! Parse a line into a list.
00231  * @param line The line of data
00232  * @return A list of strings from the line (separated by tabs).
00233  */
00234 static list<string> ParseLine(char *line)
00235 {
00236         list<string> tokens;
00237         const char *sep = "\t";
00238         char *token = strtok(line, sep);
00239         while (token != NULL)
00240         {
00241                 tokens.push_back(token);
00242                 token = strtok(NULL, sep);
00243         }
00244         return tokens;  
00245 }
00246 
00247 /*! Adds the genotype results to the CHP file. This function uses the buffer writer object
00248  * to write the data to the CHP file.
00249  * @param inFile The name of the input TSV file.
00250  * @param outFile The name of the output CHP file.
00251  * @param maxProbeSetNameLength The maximum length of the probe set names.
00252  * @param extraColTypes The types (float, int, ubyte) of the extra columns.
00253  */
00254 static void AddFileBody(const string &inFile, const string &outFile, int maxProbeSetNameLength, const vector<string>& extraColTypes)
00255 {
00256         // Create the buffer writer object
00257         CHPMultiDataFileBufferWriter genotypeEntryBufferWriter;
00258         vector<string> fileNames;
00259         fileNames.push_back(outFile);
00260     vector<MultiDataType> dataTypes;
00261     dataTypes.push_back(GenotypeMultiDataType);
00262     map<MultiDataType, int> maxLen;
00263     maxLen[GenotypeMultiDataType] = maxProbeSetNameLength;
00264         genotypeEntryBufferWriter.Initialize(&fileNames, dataTypes, maxLen);
00265 
00266         // Open the file
00267         ifstream instr(inFile.c_str(), ios::in);
00268         if (!instr)
00269                 throw string("Unable to read the input file");
00270 
00271         // First line with header
00272         char line[1024];
00273         instr.getline(line, 1024);
00274 
00275         // Get the data
00276         maxProbeSetNameLength = 0;
00277 
00278         ProbeSetMultiDataGenotypeData entry;
00279         while (instr.getline(line, 1024))
00280         {
00281                 list<string> cols = ParseLine(line);
00282                 list<string>::const_iterator colIt = cols.begin();
00283 
00284                 entry.name = *colIt;
00285                 ++colIt;
00286                 entry.call = CallToCode(*colIt);
00287                 ++colIt;
00288                 entry.confidence = (float)atof(colIt->c_str());
00289                 ++colIt;
00290 
00291                 entry.metrics.resize(cols.size() - 3);
00292                 int colIdx = 0;
00293                 for (; colIt!=cols.end(); colIt++, colIdx++)
00294                 {
00295                         if (extraColTypes[colIdx] == "float")
00296                                 entry.metrics[colIdx].SetValueFloat((float)atof(colIt->c_str()));
00297                         else if (extraColTypes[colIdx] == "int")
00298                                 entry.metrics[colIdx].SetValueInt32(atoi(colIt->c_str()));
00299                         else if (extraColTypes[colIdx] == "ubyte")
00300                                 entry.metrics[colIdx].SetValueUInt8(CallToCode(colIt->c_str()));
00301                 }
00302                 genotypeEntryBufferWriter.WriteMultiDataGenotypeEntry(GenotypeMultiDataType, 0, entry);
00303         }
00304 
00305         //Flush the buffer. The destructor will close the file.
00306         genotypeEntryBufferWriter.FlushBuffer();
00307 }
00308 
00309 
00310 /*! Reads the genotype results from a simple TSV text file.
00311  * @param inFile The name of the input TSV file.
00312  * @param maxProbeSetNameLength The maximum length of the probe set names.
00313  */
00314 static unsigned long ReadData(const string &inFile, int &maxProbeSetNameLength)
00315 {
00316         // Open the file
00317         ifstream instr(inFile.c_str(), ios::in);
00318         if (!instr)
00319                 throw string("Unable to read the input file");
00320 
00321         // First line with header
00322         char line[1024];
00323         instr.getline(line, 1024);
00324 
00325         // Get the data
00326         maxProbeSetNameLength = 0;
00327 
00328         // count keeps track of the number of rows. This now handles what used to be the data list size
00329         // given we do not read and store the data in the list anymore, we needed this value for later
00330         // see the main function for how count is used from the return of this fuction.
00331         unsigned long count = 0;
00332         while (instr.getline(line, 1024))
00333         {
00334                 list<string> cols = ParseLine(line);
00335                 maxProbeSetNameLength = max(maxProbeSetNameLength, (int) cols.begin()->size());
00336                 ++count;
00337         }
00338         return count;
00339 }

00341 /*! Show a help message on the use of the command line parameters. */
00342 static void show_help()
00343 {
00344         const char *tab = "\t";
00345         cout << "The command line arguments include" << endl;
00346         cout << tab << "-execid <the execution id>" << endl;
00347         cout << tab << "-cel <the name of the parent cel file>" << endl;
00348         cout << tab << "-in <the name of the input data file, TSV with 1 header row>" << endl;
00349         cout << tab << "-out <the name of the output CHP file>" << endl;
00350         cout << tab << "-arrayType <the probe array type>" << endl;
00351         cout << tab << "-algName <the algorithm name>" << endl;
00352         cout << tab << "-algVersion <the algorithm version>" << endl;
00353         cout << tab << "-programName <the program name>" << endl;
00354         cout << tab << "-programVersion <the program version>" << endl;
00355         cout << tab << "-programCompany <the name of the company>" << endl;
00356         cout << tab << "-colNames <a list of column names in the input file, not including" << endl;
00357         cout << tab << "                   the probe set name, call and confidence>" << endl;
00358         cout << tab << "-colTypes <a list of column types, either \"float\" or \"int\" or \"ubyte\">" << endl;
00359         cout << tab << "-paramNames <a list of parameter names>" << endl;
00360         cout << tab << "-paramValues <a list of parameter values>" << endl;
00361         cout << tab << "-sumNames <a list of summary parameter names>" << endl;
00362         cout << tab << "-sumValues <a list of summary parameter values>" << endl;
00363         cout << tab << "-extraNames <a list of extra parameter names>" << endl;
00364         cout << tab << "-extraValues <a list of extra parameter values>" << endl;
00365         cout << endl;
00366         cout << "The input file must have the probe set name, call (AA, AB, BB, No Call)" << endl <<
00367                         "and confidence as the first three columns. All other columns must be of" << endl <<
00368                         "either floating point of integer type. Use the colTypes to specify the" << endl <<
00369                         "type. The paramNames and paramValues arguments are used to specify" << endl <<
00370                         "algorithm parameter." << endl;
00371 }
00372 
00373 /*! The main entrance to the program. */
00374 int main(int argc, char * argv[])
00375 {
00376         try
00377         {
00378                 // Parse the command line arguments.
00379                 CCmdLine cmdLine;
00380                 if (cmdLine.SplitLine(argc, argv) < 1)
00381                 {
00382                         show_help();
00383                         exit(-1);
00384                 }
00385 
00386                 string execId = cmdLine.GetArgument("-execid", 0);
00387                 string celFile = cmdLine.GetSafeArgument("-cel", 0, "");
00388                 string inFile = cmdLine.GetArgument("-in", 0);
00389                 string outFile = cmdLine.GetArgument("-out", 0);
00390                 string arrayType = cmdLine.GetArgument("-arrayType", 0);
00391                 string algName = cmdLine.GetArgument("-algName", 0);
00392                 string algVersion = cmdLine.GetArgument("-algVersion", 0);
00393                 string programName = cmdLine.GetArgument("-programName", 0);
00394                 string programVersion = cmdLine.GetArgument("-programVersion", 0);
00395                 string programCompany = cmdLine.GetArgument("-programCompany", 0);
00396 
00397                 vector<string> colNames;
00398                 int n = cmdLine.GetArgumentCount("-colNames");
00399                 for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00400                         colNames.push_back(cmdLine.GetArgument("-colNames", i));
00401 
00402                 vector<string> colTypes;
00403                 n = cmdLine.GetArgumentCount("-colTypes");
00404                 for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00405                         colTypes.push_back(cmdLine.GetArgument("-colTypes", i));
00406 
00407                 vector<string> paramNames;
00408                 n = cmdLine.GetArgumentCount("-paramNames");
00409                 for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00410                         paramNames.push_back(cmdLine.GetArgument("-paramNames", i));
00411 
00412                 vector<string> paramValues;
00413                 n = cmdLine.GetArgumentCount("-paramValues");
00414                 for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00415                         paramValues.push_back(cmdLine.GetArgument("-paramValues", i));
00416 
00417                 vector<string> sumNames;
00418                 n = cmdLine.GetArgumentCount("-sumNames");
00419                 for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00420                         sumNames.push_back(cmdLine.GetArgument("-sumNames", i));
00421 
00422                 vector<string> sumValues;
00423                 n = cmdLine.GetArgumentCount("-sumValues");
00424                 for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00425                         sumValues.push_back(cmdLine.GetArgument("-sumValues", i));
00426 
00427                 vector<string> extraNames;
00428                 n = cmdLine.GetArgumentCount("-extraNames");
00429                 for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00430                         extraNames.push_back(cmdLine.GetArgument("-extraNames", i));
00431 
00432                 vector<string> extraValues;
00433                 n = cmdLine.GetArgumentCount("-extraValues");
00434                 for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00435                         extraValues.push_back(cmdLine.GetArgument("-extraValues", i));
00436 
00437                 // Read the TSV input file
00438                 int maxProbeSetNameLength = 0;
00439 
00440                 // data collection is no longer used, so we have ReadData return the row count so that we can pass it into
00441                 // CreateFileWithHeader call
00442                 unsigned long rowCount = ReadData(inFile, maxProbeSetNameLength);
00443 
00444                 // Create the CHP file.
00445                 // Creates the header
00446                 CreateFileWithHeader(execId, celFile, outFile, colNames, colTypes, rowCount, maxProbeSetNameLength,
00447                         algName, algVersion, arrayType, programName, programVersion, programCompany, paramNames, paramValues,
00448                         sumNames, sumValues, extraNames, extraValues);
00449 
00450                 // add the body (data)
00451                 AddFileBody(inFile,outFile, maxProbeSetNameLength, colTypes);
00452         }
00453         catch (string s)
00454         {
00455                 cout << s << endl;
00456                 show_help();
00457         }
00458         catch (int e)
00459         {
00460                 cout << "Invalid argument" << endl;
00461                 show_help();
00462         }
00463         catch (...)
00464         {
00465                 cout << "Unknown error" << endl;
00466                 show_help();
00467         }
00468         return 0;
00469 }
